26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_pmu_base.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:35 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include "priv.h"
30
31#include <subdev/timer.h>
32
33void
34nvkm_pmu_pgob(struct nvkm_pmu *pmu, bool enable)
35{
36 if (pmu && pmu->func->pgob)
37 pmu->func->pgob(pmu, enable);
38}
39
40int
41nvkm_pmu_send(struct nvkm_pmu *pmu, u32 reply[2],
42 u32 process, u32 message, u32 data0, u32 data1)
43{
44 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &pmu->subdev;
45 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
46 u32 addr;
47
48 /* wait for a free slot in the fifo */
49 addr = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4a0);
50 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
51 u32 tmp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4b0);
52 if (tmp != (addr ^ 8))
53 break;
54 ) < 0)
55 return -EBUSY;
56
57 /* we currently only support a single process at a time waiting
58 * on a synchronous reply, take the PMU mutex and tell the
59 * receive handler what we're waiting for
60 */
61 if (reply) {
62 mutex_lock(&subdev->mutex);
63 pmu->recv.message = message;
64 pmu->recv.process = process;
65 }
66
67 /* acquire data segment access */
68 do {
69 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a580, 0x00000001);
70 } while (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a580) != 0x00000001);
71
72 /* write the packet */
73 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c0, 0x01000000 | (((addr & 0x07) << 4) +
74 pmu->send.base));
75 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c4, process);
76 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c4, message);
77 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c4, data0);
78 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c4, data1);
79 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a4a0, (addr + 1) & 0x0f);
80
81 /* release data segment access */
82 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a580, 0x00000000);
83
84 /* wait for reply, if requested */
85 if (reply) {
86#ifdef __NetBSD__
87 int ret;
88
89 DRM_WAIT_NOINTR_UNTIL(ret, &pmu->recv.wait, &subdev->mutex,
90 (pmu->recv.process == 0));
91 KASSERT(ret == 0);
92#else
93 wait_event(pmu->recv.wait, (pmu->recv.process == 0));
94#endif
95 reply[0] = pmu->recv.data[0];
96 reply[1] = pmu->recv.data[1];
97 mutex_unlock(&subdev->mutex);
98 }
99
100 return 0;
101}
102
103static void
104nvkm_pmu_recv(struct work_struct *work)
105{
106 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu = container_of(work, struct nvkm_pmu, recv.work);
107 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &pmu->subdev;
108 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
109 u32 process, message, data0, data1;
110
111 /* nothing to do if GET == PUT */
112 u32 addr = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4cc);
113 if (addr == nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4c8))
114 return;
115
116 /* acquire data segment access */
117 do {
118 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a580, 0x00000002);
119 } while (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a580) != 0x00000002);
120
121 /* read the packet */
122 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c0, 0x02000000 | (((addr & 0x07) << 4) +
123 pmu->recv.base));
124 process = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a1c4);
125 message = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a1c4);
126 data0 = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a1c4);
127 data1 = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a1c4);
128 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a4cc, (addr + 1) & 0x0f);
129
130 /* release data segment access */
131 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a580, 0x00000000);
132
133 /* wake process if it's waiting on a synchronous reply */
134 if (pmu->recv.process) {
135 mutex_lock(&subdev->mutex);
136 if (process == pmu->recv.process &&
137 message == pmu->recv.message) {
138 pmu->recv.data[0] = data0;
139 pmu->recv.data[1] = data1;
140 pmu->recv.process = 0;
141#ifdef __NetBSD__
142 DRM_WAKEUP_ONE(&pmu->recv.wait, &subdev->mutex);
143#else
144 wake_up(&pmu->recv.wait);
145#endif
146 return;
147 }
148 mutex_unlock(&subdev->mutex);
149 }
150
151 /* right now there's no other expected responses from the engine,
152 * so assume that any unexpected message is an error.
153 */
154 nvkm_warn(subdev, "%c%c%c%c %08x %08x %08x %08x\n",
155 (char)((process & 0x000000ff) >> 0),
156 (char)((process & 0x0000ff00) >> 8),
157 (char)((process & 0x00ff0000) >> 16),
158 (char)((process & 0xff000000) >> 24),
159 process, message, data0, data1);
160}
161
162static void
163nvkm_pmu_intr(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
164{
165 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu = nvkm_pmu(subdev);
166 struct nvkm_device *device = pmu->subdev.device;
167 u32 disp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a01c);
168 u32 intr = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a008) & disp & ~(disp >> 16);
169
170 if (intr & 0x00000020) {
171 u32 stat = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a16c);
172 if (stat & 0x80000000) {
173 nvkm_error(subdev, "UAS fault at %06x addr %08x\n",
174 stat & 0x00ffffff,
175 nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a168));
176 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a16c, 0x00000000);
177 intr &= ~0x00000020;
178 }
179 }
180
181 if (intr & 0x00000040) {
182 schedule_work(&pmu->recv.work);
183 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a004, 0x00000040);
184 intr &= ~0x00000040;
185 }
186
187 if (intr & 0x00000080) {
188 nvkm_info(subdev, "wr32 %06x %08x\n",
189 nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a7a0),
190 nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a7a4));
191 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a004, 0x00000080);
192 intr &= ~0x00000080;
193 }
194
195 if (intr) {
196 nvkm_error(subdev, "intr %08x\n", intr);
197 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a004, intr);
198 }
199}
200
201static int
202nvkm_pmu_fini(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev, bool suspend)
203{
204 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu = nvkm_pmu(subdev);
205 struct nvkm_device *device = pmu->subdev.device;
206
207 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a014, 0x00000060);
208 flush_work(&pmu->recv.work);
209 return 0;
210}
211
212static int
213nvkm_pmu_init(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
214{
215 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu = nvkm_pmu(subdev);
216 struct nvkm_device *device = pmu->subdev.device;
217 int i;
218
219 /* prevent previous ucode from running, wait for idle, reset */
220 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a014, 0x0000ffff); /* INTR_EN_CLR = ALL */
221 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
222 if (!nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a04c))
223 break;
224 );
225 nvkm_mask(device, 0x000200, 0x00002000, 0x00000000);
226 nvkm_mask(device, 0x000200, 0x00002000, 0x00002000);
227 nvkm_rd32(device, 0x000200);
228 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
229 if (!(nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a10c) & 0x00000006))
230 break;
231 );
232
233 /* upload data segment */
234 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c0, 0x01000000);
235 for (i = 0; i < pmu->func->data.size / 4; i++)
236 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a1c4, pmu->func->data.data[i]);
237
238 /* upload code segment */
239 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a180, 0x01000000);
240 for (i = 0; i < pmu->func->code.size / 4; i++) {
241 if ((i & 0x3f) == 0)
242 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a188, i >> 6);
243 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a184, pmu->func->code.data[i]);
244 }
245
246 /* start it running */
247 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a10c, 0x00000000);
248 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a104, 0x00000000);
249 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a100, 0x00000002);
250
251 /* wait for valid host->pmu ring configuration */
252 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
253 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4d0))
254 break;
255 ) < 0)
256 return -EBUSY;
257 pmu->send.base = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4d0) & 0x0000ffff;
258 pmu->send.size = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4d0) >> 16;
259
260 /* wait for valid pmu->host ring configuration */
261 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
262 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4dc))
263 break;
264 ) < 0)
265 return -EBUSY;
266 pmu->recv.base = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4dc) & 0x0000ffff;
267 pmu->recv.size = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10a4dc) >> 16;
268
269 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10a010, 0x000000e0);
270 return 0;
271}
272
273static void *
274nvkm_pmu_dtor(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
275{
276 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu = nvkm_pmu(subdev);
277
278#ifdef __NetBSD__
279 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&pmu->recv.wait);
280#endif
281
282 return pmu;
283}
284
285static const struct nvkm_subdev_func
286nvkm_pmu = {
287 .dtor = nvkm_pmu_dtor,
288 .init = nvkm_pmu_init,
289 .fini = nvkm_pmu_fini,
290 .intr = nvkm_pmu_intr,
291};
292
293int
294nvkm_pmu_new_(const struct nvkm_pmu_func *func, struct nvkm_device *device,
295 int index, struct nvkm_pmu **ppmu)
296{
297 struct nvkm_pmu *pmu;
298 if (!(pmu = *ppmu = kzalloc(sizeof(*pmu), GFP_KERNEL)))
299 return -ENOMEM;
300 nvkm_subdev_ctor(&nvkm_pmu, device, index, 0, &pmu->subdev);
301 pmu->func = func;
302 INIT_WORK(&pmu->recv.work, nvkm_pmu_recv);
303#ifdef __NetBSD__
304 DRM_INIT_WAITQUEUE(&pmu->recv.wait, "nvpmu");
305#else
306 init_waitqueue_head(&pmu->recv.wait);
307#endif
308 return 0;
309}
